wikipedia_page.main: Stephen Daniel Double (born 19 December 1966) is a British Conservative Party politician and has been the Member of Parliament (MP) for St Austell and Newquay since 2015.Double served on Cornwall Council and as a town councillor and deputy mayor of St Austell before his selection as Conservative candidate for St Austell and Newquay in the general election.

response: * Steve Double (born 1966), British Conservative Party politician, Member of Parliament (MP) for St Austell and Newquay since 2015

link_mentions.page: List of Parliamentary constituencies in Cornwall

response: Grampound is in the St Austell and Newquay constituency and the Member for Parliament is Steve Double (Conservative). Notably in the past Grampound was a 'rotten borough' returning two members of parliament of its own until 1821.

link_mentions.page: St Austell and Newquay (UK Parliament constituency)
response: St Austell and Newquay is a constituency represented in the House of Commons of the UK Parliament since 2015 by Steve Double, a Conservative.

Theresa May announced a snap election would take place on 8 June 2017. In this constituency, Conservative incumbent Steve Double won with an increased majority of 11,142. The constituency also saw a gigantic 18.8% increase in the Labour vote, in common with many south-west seats, pushing the Liberal Democrats into third place.
* Steve Double, Conservative MP since 2015 for St Austell and Newquay

response: but lost his seat at the 2015 general election to the Conservative Party candidate Steve Double. He now teaches politics at Highgate School, having previously taught history and politics at the King's School, Worcester.
